Prerequisites: PREREQUISITES: CGS 2100 OR EQUIVALENT, ACG 3301 WITH A GRADE OF C OR HIGHER.
Course Description:
COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS OF ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS AND
PRACTICES IN DIFFERENT COUNTRIES; INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS; PROBLEMS OF ACCOUNTING FOR MULTINATIONAL CORPORATIONS, INCLUDING TRANSFERS OF FUNDS AND INCOME MEASUREMENT; AND THE ROLE OF ACCOUNTING IN NATIONAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
